title: Artful Adventures in Antalya's Gallery Scene

places.generalDescription: Massive event & exhibition hall set in an easygoing city greenspace with scenic sea views.

sources.snippet: The Glass Pyramid (Glass Pyramid Sabancƒ± Congress and Exhibition Center) is located in the Atat√ºrk Cultural Park Complex and opens its doors to concerts, festivals and performances. Visitors can take the opportunity to visit the Atat√ºrk Cultural Park and enjoy the great view of the Konyaaltƒ± Cliffs and Beydaƒülarƒ± Mountains after or before the performances.

places.name: Glass Pyramid Exhibition and Convention Center

reviews.text: I recommend visiting this place primarily for its scenery. It feels like you've suddenly stepped into Switzerland-so peaceful and stunning.

Nice place for exhibitions
Is close to Beach Park as well

As a tourist, foreigner, absolutely nothing to do here, on a random weekday, nice weather.  We were basically chased out.  Not much friendly here.  The park is not really that nice either.  Decent stone path with trees to get out of there, to the cliff and sea.

places.address: Meltem, Sakƒ±p Sabancƒ± Blv. No:9, 07030 Muratpa≈üa/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Antalya Aquarium is a popular attraction near Konyaalti Beach, offering themed exhibits, a long tunnel tank, and tropical reptiles. It's known for being the largest aquarium tunnel in the world, making it a must-visit spot for families with children. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely stroll while marveling at an impressive collection of marine life from various seas and oceans, including sharks and other aquatic animals like Sting Rays, Red Dragon Fish, and California Moray.

sources.snippet: One of the largest aquarium complexes in the whole world, Antalya‚Äôs fantastic aquarium is as educational as it is entertaining; its 40 themed aquariums certainly make for a fun day out for all of the family. With the longest tunnel aquarium in the world for you to enjoy, there is absolutely loads to see and do; the tropical reptile house is also well worth checking out. In addition to this, a Snow World and Ice Museum are also part of the complex; you can have snowball fights and play about in the icy wonderland.
sources.shortName: Best Things to Do in Antalya, Turkey (+Photos)

sources.snippet: You'll combine sightseeing and shopping on this Antalya tour with a difference. Get the lowdown on the best gold from the region, visit Antalya Aquarium and enjoy a guided tour through the old town with some free time to bargain for souvenirs.

The Antalya Aquarium is one of the largest aquarium complexes in the world and is located in the Konyaalti Beach area of Antalya. It offers a unique opportunity to explore the fascinating marine life from different regions of the world.
sources.shortName: Top Things to do in Antalya

places.name: Antalya Aquarium

reviews.text: The aquarium itself was very beautiful. Nothing too different from the others we've been, but still worth to visit if you're there. But the kids were absolutely amazed with the snow room. It's tiny, but has a few ice slides and a cosy little cafeteria.

Overpriced, unfriendly staff, and just not worth it

We were really disappointed with this visit. The aquarium is small for the price-yes, there are some nice fish, but definitely not enough to justify the cost. Not many sharks either, and the so-called ‚Äúlongest tunnel‚Äù wasn't anything special.

What made the experience worse was the staff. They were not friendly at all, and made a fuss because we bought tickets online. It felt like they were trying to find ways to charge us more.

Also, charging kids from 3 years old is just ridiculous. For a place this size, that feels greedy more than anything else.

Unless you get in at a heavily discounted price, I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. It's clearly a ripoff.

Visited on August 15, 2025. Paid 40 dollars per person as foreing citizens for just aquarium itself. If booked online via the aquarium's official site in advance, it costs 36 dollars instead. Overall it was nice but it is a bit pricey for what it offered.
It is home to the world's largest tunnel aquarium, stretching 131 meters in length. Inside, visitors can marvel at a life-size airplane and shipwreck, while coming face to face with majestic sharks.
